verb.description: Win a victory over (someone) in a battle or other contest; overcome or beat.
examples: Arab armies defeated the Byzantine garrison

noun.description: An instance of defeating or being defeated.
examples: she had still not quite admitted defeat
the defeat of the Armada in 1588

origin: Late Middle English (in the sense undo, destroy, annul): from Old French desfait undone, past participle of desfaire, from medieval Latin disfacere undo.
